summary:
• Canadian researchers discover wreckage of Sir Ernest Shackleton's ship.
• The discovery sheds light on the famous Antarctic explorer's final moments.
• The finding provides valuable insights into Shackleton's tragic demise.

• Cuban officials welcome Russian naval fleet in Havana
• Russian warships arrive in Havana
• Strengthening ties between Russia and Cuba

• Kylian Mbappé encourages young people to vote against extremism.
• Paris rehearses its Olympic opening ceremony on the Seine River.
• The city prepares for the upcoming event by practicing the opening ceremonies.

• A man wielding an axe was shot by police in Hamburg.
• The incident sparked alarm among residents and authorities alike.
• The motive behind the attack remains unknown at this time.

• An exam sparks national outrage due to alleged cheating.
• The incident is widely condemned by Indian citizens.
• Authorities investigate the matter.

• Iran has given a Nobel laureate a new prison sentence
• The sentence was imposed by an Iranian court
• The exact duration of the sentence is unknown

• Israel claims that the Rafah attack is nearing completion, potentially shifting the dynamics of the ongoing conflict.
• In a show of force, Jerusalem police have violently dispersed protesters calling for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's resignation.
• Despite dissolving the war cabinet, Netanyahu has stated his intention to exclude the far-right factions from any subsequent decision-making processes.

• A parkour group's attempted stunt damaged an historic Italian building.
• The incident occurred during their practice session at the site.
• Authorities have launched an investigation to determine responsibility for the damage.

• Kenya has scrapped its controversial bread tax amidst widespread protests.
• The decision comes after demonstrators were teargassed by security forces during clashes with authorities.
• The move is seen as a major concession to anti-government sentiment in the country.

• The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) has suspended avocado inspections in a specific Mexican state due to security concerns.
• This decision was made to address potential threats related to food safety or other issues that could impact public health.
• As a result, the quality control process for avocados will be temporarily halted until further notice.

• NK soldiers cross border
• Warning shots fired by South Korean military
• Tensions escalate between two nations

• Extreme heat is taking a devastating toll on overcrowded prisons in the Philippines.
• The sweltering conditions are exacerbating existing health issues among inmates, who often lack access to proper healthcare.
• As temperatures soar, authorities face growing pressure to address the crisis and find solutions to mitigate its impact on prisoners' well-being.

• Portugal secures last-minute victory over Czech Republic
• The match ended with a dramatic turnaround in favor of Portugal
• This win marks a significant boost to Portugal's morale ahead of future competitions

• A huge oil spill has blackened Singapore's picturesque beaches.
• The incident has affected the environment and tourism in the area.
• Efforts are underway to clean up the spill and minimize its impact on local ecosystems.

• South African walls feature artwork depicting the "Big Five" wildlife species.
• The artworks showcase the country's rich cultural heritage through its love for nature.
• This unique blend of culture and conservation promotes appreciation for South Africa's natural beauty.

• Thailand passes landmark bill legalizing same-sex marriage
• The legislation marks a significant step forward in LGBTQ+ rights
• Same-sex couples can now legally marry and access equal rights and benefits

• Biden faces backlash regardless of his approach to immigration policy.
• The CEO of Boeing faced questioning from lawmakers and victims.
• A secret service agent was robbed during a fundraiser for Biden.

• Kyiv celebrated its first Pride parade since the invasion, with LGBTQ+ soldiers demanding equal rights.
• Despite being away from war zones, Ukrainian soccer players prepare to face challenges on the field.
• The country's athletes continue to perform under difficult circumstances.
